did.abstract: Minority student advisor for the University of Michigan Law School from 1988-1995. Collection includes materials related to the Law School, students, and minority student activities as well as personal correspondence from students and photographs.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: Donated by Sharon Lewis (donor no. 10979), in August, 2013.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Dores McCree papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Dores McCree was an advisor to minority students at the University of Michigan Law School from 1988-1995 with duties that included recruitment of minority students, career counseling, and coordination of minority student events.

Dores was married to Wade H. McCree, Jr. who served as a Judge on the Wayne County Circuit Court, the U.S. District Court for Eastern Michigan and as U.S. Solicitor General. He was a law professor at the University of Michigan from 1981 until his death in 1987, at which point Dores began her work with the law school. The McCrees had three children, Kathleen, Wade III, and Karen.

arrangement.p: The collection is divided into two series: Law School Publications and Events and Personal Materials.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains records and publications pertaining to the University of Michigan Law School, its minority student programs and recruitment activities, and personal correspondence between Dores McCree and students she worked with.

The Law School Publications and Events series (1 linear foot, 1985-1999) consists primarily of published materials related to the law school, its students, faculty, and minority student activities. These include photographic directories, career services publications, faculty biographies, and minority events and enrollment information.
The Personal Papers series (0.5 linear feet, 1987-1995) includes correspondence from students and photographs of commencement activities and other campus events.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Law School (University of Michigan) oral history interviews, 1988-2002 collection includes an oral history interview with Dores McCree.

The papers of Dores McCree's husband, Wade H. McCree Jr. are located at Wayne State University's Walter P. Reuther library and include personal correspondence between Wade and Dores McCree as well as family photos and other information.
